abstract.text: A programmatic ad monetization platform for mobile games and apps.

abstract.text: Objects used for request and response of both banner and fullscreen ads.
The following types are used when creating adapters, and should not be needed in most implementations.

manages ads for one placement.

which partner fullscreen ads should conform to.

Protocol that defines how a partner ad communicates life-cycle events back to the Chartboost Mediation SDK.
A prebidding info request.
A configuration type that contains adapter and partner info.
It may also be used to expose custom partner SDK options to the publisher.
The main interface to the Chartboost Mediation SDK that provides some configuration options.
A programmatic ad monetization platform for mobile games and apps.
Ad format.
The result of a banner load operation.
A protocol to which ads created by
types conform to.
Partner ads are in charge of communicating with a single partner SDK ad instance and reporting back ad life-cycle
events corresponding to that ad to the Chartboost Mediation SDK.
They also keep track of information related to a single load request.
A type of
which partner banner ads should conform to.
A result returned by Chartboost Mediation at the end of an ad show operation.
A Chartboost Mediation fullscreen ad ready to be shown.
Error type passed by the Chartboost Mediation SDK in its public delegate methods to provide context relative to the failure of a
certain operation.
A view that can load and display a Chartboost Mediation banner ad.
Chartboost Mediation SDK error codes.

that identifies a partner.
A base class inherited by other request types.
A partner ad load request.
Exposes storage managed by the Chartboost Mediation SDK to the adapter.
Extra information related to a partner event as a dictionary.
Pass an empty dictionary when there are no details to pass back to the Chartboost Mediation SDK.
The type of a banner ad.
Delegate protocol for getting notified about
events.
The size of a partner loaded banner ad.

A result returned by Chartboost Mediation at the end of an ad load operation.
A request used to load a banner ad.
Provides the capability to generate errors suitable to be passed in completion handlers for
operations.
All functionality is provided by default implementations.
The protocol to which all partner adapters conform to.
It defines how Chartboost Mediation SDK and its mediated networks communicate.
